column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St drops on oil and Apple weakness
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 30 Wall Street dropped on Wednesday as Brent crude slid towards 11-year lows and Apple weighed on the S&P 500 index  which clung to a meager gain for 2015.

column4: Apple to pay Italy 318 mln euros  sign tax deal - source
column5: Apple Inc will pay Italy's tax office 318 million euros ($348 million) to settle a dispute over allegations it failed to pay taxes for six years  a source with direct knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: Apple to pay Italy 318 mln euros  sign tax deal
column5: MILAN  Dec 30 U.S. tech giant Apple will pay the Italian tax office 318 million euros ($348 million) to settle a dispute and sign an accord early next year on how to manage its tax liabilities from 2015 onwards  a source close to the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: Italy tax office reaches deal with Apple
column5: MILAN Italy's tax office said on Wednesday it had reached a deal with U.S. tech giant Apple in a dispute over taxes but declined to comment on details of the settlement.

column4: Caesars fends off bondholders' request for quick ruling
column5: WILMINGTON  Del. Caesars Entertainment Corp  defeated bondholder demands for an early resolution of a lawsuit alleging the casino company failed to honor guarantees of bonds issued by its bankrupt subsidiary  sending the case to trial.

column4: Facebook's Free Basics service suspended in Egypt
column5: CAIRO A Facebook-sponsored service that offers limited free Internet access was suspended in Egypt on Wednesday after a permit required from the government was not renewed  an official from the Telecommunications Ministry told Reuters.

column4: Facebook lawsuit against fugitive's lawyers is thrown out
column5: NEW YORK A New York state appeals court on Tuesday threw out Facebook Inc's unusual malicious prosecution lawsuit against DLA Piper and two other law firms that have represented a fugitive who claimed a 50 percent stake in the social media company.

column4: Icahn to buy Pep Boys for $1 billion after Bridgestone bows out
column5: Carl Icahn's Icahn Enterprises LP has agreed to buy Pep Boys-Manny Moe & Jack for about $1 billion  the companies said on Wednesday  hours after Bridgestone Corp quit the race for the U.S. auto parts retailer.

column4: U.S. judge tosses Allergan extortion lawsuit against fund over patent
column5: Allergan PLC's extortion claims against a venture fund that tried to challenge the validity of one of its patents do not belong in federal court  a federal judge has ruled.

column4: BlackRock sells Kuala Lumpur mall to Malaysia's Pavilion
column5: KUALA LUMPUR BlackRock  the world's largest asset manager  said on Wednesday it has sold a luxury shopping mall in central Kuala Lumpur to Malaysia's Pavilion Real Estate Investment Trust (Pavilion REIT)  for 160 million ringgit ($37.33 million).

column4: China Telecom chairman steps down amid investigation
column5: HONG KONG  Dec 30 State-run China Telecom Corp Ltd said on Wednesday that Chairman and Chief Eexecutive Chang Xiaobing has resigned with immediate effect  just days after authorities said he was being investigated for alleged disciplinary violation.

column4: Recall Notice: Ford headlights  Sweet Leaf Tea and bean-bag chairs
column5: This December  Ford recalled more than 300 000 older vehicles with faulty headlights that have been blamed for 11 accidents  and Sweet Leaf Tea Corp had to pull some of its 16-ounce bottled beverages from shelves after four customers complained about finding glass fragments.

column4: Institutions commit to $154 mln in Gazit-Globe share offering
column5: TEL AVIV  Dec 30 Gazit-Globe  Israel's largest real estate investment company  has accepted 600 million shekels ($154 million) in precommitments from institutional investors in a planned share offering in Tel Aviv.

column4: Lockheed wins more than $1 billion contract for C-130J aircraft
column5: Lockheed Martin Corp has been awarded a contract worth more than $1 billion for 32 C-130J aircraft  the Pentagon said on Wednesday.

column4: European Factors to Watch-Shares expected to be steady at open
column5: LONDON  Dec 30 European stocks were seen steady at the open on Wednesday  although a pullback in oil prices could weigh on the shares of energy companies.

column4: Delayed refinery restart sparks Brazil fuel shortage  source says
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO A delay in re-starting a unit at a Petroleo Brasileiro SA refinery and an unexpected spike in gasoline demand have led to fuel shortages in northeastern Brazil  a company source with direct knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: Exclusive: U.S. ties ex-Panamanian president to SAP software bribery scheme
column5: WASHINGTON/MEXICO CITY A U.S. federal judge identified the former president of Panama  Ricardo Martinelli  as one of several alleged co-conspirators in a bribery scheme that helped SAP to sell millions of dollars in software to Panama  according to a document reviewed by Reuters.

column4: One dead  two injured after wave hits North Sea drilling rig
column5: OSLO One person died and two were injured on Wednesday when a big wave hit a rig belonging to China's Chinese Oilfield Services Ltd that had been drilling at the Statoil-operated Troll field offshore Norway  the Norwegian company said.

column4: UPDATE 1-Telus settles with watchdog  to pay customers C$7.34 mln in rebates
column5: TORONTO  Dec 30 Canadian telecoms provider Telus Corp signed an deal with the country's Competition Bureau to give its wireless customers up to C$7.34 million ($5.27 million) in rebates after the competition watchdog found some Telus promotions misleading.
